availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis Milton Ricketts (Montgomery County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of H. Ricketts and Mary Ricketts. Clerk in Montgomery County in 1850. Merchant in Montgomery County in 1860. Quartermaster in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from August 29, 1862, to March 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 82A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 50.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 2, p. 29.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 132.
Card Records of Headstones Provided for Deceased Union Civil War Veterans, ca. 1879-ca. 1903, NARA Records of the Office of the Quartermaster General, RG 92, Series M1845.
